meanings.definition: A fold or crease in a material or structure.
meanings.sent1: The paper had a neat plicature along its edge.
meanings.sent2: She carefully ironed the plicature in the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The plicature in the map made it look like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: His face showed a plicature of worry as he read the letter.
meanings.sent5: The plicature in the road indicated where the earthquake had shifted the land.

meanings.definition: The act of folding or creasing something.
meanings.sent1: Her plicature of the napkin was precise and elegant.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated the plicature of the origami crane to the class.
meanings.sent3: The plicature of the dough was so perfect that it looked like art.
meanings.sent4: The plicature of events led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent5: The plicature of time seemed to slow down in that moment.

meanings.sent1: She would plicature the letter before sealing it in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: He carefully plicatured the edges of the gift box.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to plicature the card out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: The tailor would plicature the fabric to create intricate designs.
meanings.sent5: The artist would plicature the paper to start a new origami project.
